contentrichtext.text: {{unreferenced|date=June 2008}} {{Infobox mountain | name = Schlern | photo = Schlern - Gflirer Weiher.jpg | photo_caption = Schlern | elevation_m = 2563 | elevation_ref = | prominence = | map = Alps | map_caption = Location in the Alps | location = [[Italy]] | range = [[Dolomites]] | lat_d = 46 | lat_m = 30 | lat_s = 54 | lat_NS = N | long_d = 11 | long_m = 34 | long_s = 32 | long_EW = E | region = IT | first_ascent = }} The '''Schlern''' ({{lang-it|Sciliar}}, [[Ladin language|Ladin]]: ''Sciliër'') (2,563 m) is a [[mountain]] of the [[Dolomites]] in [[South Tyrol]], [[Italy]]. The peak at the north west end of the mountain (left, in the image at right) was first ascended in July 1880 by [[Johann Santner]]. It is named the Santner Spitze in his honour. The Schlern dominates the villages of [[Seis am Schlern]] and [[Völs am Schlern]], and the summit can be reached following the circular route marked with the number 1 from both villages. At {{convert|1700|m|ft|0}}, there is the ''Schlernboden'' inn and on the summit plateau is the ''Schlernhaus'' inn {{convert|2457|m|ft|0}}, both open from 1 June to 15 October. The Schlern is sung of in the ''[[Bozner Bergsteigerlied]]'' as one of South Tyrol's landmarks. Its characteristic profile appears on the [[Der Schlern|''Der Schlern - Zeitschrift für Südtiroler Landeskunde'']] (Magazine for [[South Tyrol]]ean Regional Studies) and the logo pressed into [[Loacker]]'s [[Wafer (cooking)|wafer]] biscuits. ==Gallery== <Gallery> Image:Schlern in winter.jpg Image:Schlern in der Abendsonne.jpg Image:Schlern_pano.jpg Image:Schlern-seiseralm.jpg Image:Schlern - Knüppelsteig 01.jpg|The southern summit approach </Gallery> ==External links== {{commonscat-inline|Schlern}} * [http://www.summitpost.org/mountain/rock/152349/schlern-sciliar.html Schlern article from summitpost.org] [[Category:Mountains of South Tyrol]] {{TrentinoAltoAdige-geo-stub}}
